medical_history.chief_complaint: Erythroderma, protracted diarrhea, and pulmonary abscesses caused by Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented at the age of four months with symptoms of erythroderma, protracted diarrhea, and pulmonary abscesses. Over the next two years, he experienced recurrent episodes of herpes simplex virus infection of the mouth and skin, and episodes of oral and skin infections with Candida albicans, as well as two pulmonary infections.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Severe immunodeficiency associated with CD3Î¶ deficiency.
medical_history.family_history: Two older siblings were healthy; father is of unknown paternity.
